Questions.QuestionString: Describe the features of the Trent XWB Engine?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: A two concentric shaft configuration with a very high by pass ratio with one piece disc and blade combination (Blisk) compressor design.
A three concentric shaft configuration with a very high by pass ratio with one piece disc and blade combination (Blisk) compressor design.
A three concentric shaft configuration with a very high by pass ratio with one piece disc and blade combination (Blisk) turbine design.

Questions.QuestionString: How many shafts does the Trent XWB-84  have?(A, B1, B2)
Most thrust is provided by?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: A gas flow that drives the turbines.

Questions.QuestionString: Where is the external gearbox located?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: At the bottom of the Fan Case
At the bottom of the Intermediate case.
At the bottom of the HPC rear case.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the direction of rotations for the engine’s shafts when seen from the front?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: LP&IP rotor turn CW (Clock-Wise), HP rotor turns CCW (Counter Clock-Wise).
LP&IP rotor turn CCW, HP rotor turns CW.
LP rotor turns CCW ( Counter  Clock-Wise), IP&HP rotor turn CW (Clock-Wise).

Questions.QuestionString: What should be considered when ground running an engine?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Weather conditions, wind directions, gusting, operational limits.
MP task of the engine operational limits.
MP task of the engine safety precautions.

Questions.QuestionString: What does the LP system consists of ?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: A single stage compressor (Fan) assembly driven by a four-stage turbine.
A single stage compressor (Fan) assembly driven by a five-stage turbine.
A single stage compressor (Fan) assembly driven by a six-stage turbine.

Questions.QuestionString: What does the IP system consists of ?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: eight-stage axial flow compressor driven by a two-stage turbine.
nine-stage axial flow compressor driven by a two-stage turbine.
ten-stage axial flow compressor driven by a two-stage turbine.

Questions.QuestionString: What does the HP system consists of ?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: six-stage axial flow compressor driven by a single-stage turbine.
five-stage axial flow compressor driven by a single-stage turbine.
four-stage axial flow compressor driven by a single-stage turbine.

Questions.QuestionString: How many sealed compartment( Fire Zone) does the Trent WXB-84 engine have?(A, B1, B2)
The External Gearbox (EGB) is driven by:(A, B1, B2)
The thrust of the engine Trent WXB-84 is flat rated up to:(A, B1, B2)
The description of the combustion system on engine Trent WXB-84 is as follow:(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Annular construction incorporating 20 fuel spray nozzles and 2 igniter plugs.
Annular construction incorporating 24 fuel spray nozzles and 2 igniter plugs.
Annular construction incorporating 30 fuel spray nozzles and 2 igniter plugs.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the risk when applying the molybdenum disulfide lubricant?:(A, B1, B2)
Answers: The lubricants decomposes at high tension load and release sulfur. Sulfur can cause damage to the lubricated engine part.
The lubricants decomposes at high temperatures (> 300 OC) and release sulfur. Sulfur can cause damage to the lubricated engine part.
The lubricants decomposes at high mechanical load and release sulfur. Sulfur can cause damage to the lubricated engine part.

Questions.QuestionString: A” CRACKED” damage type to metal parts is define as:(A, B1, B2)
Answers: A linear opening that can cause the material to break.
Damage to the surface of a part when it is hit with an object.
A damage that changes the initial shape or contour of a material.

Questions.QuestionString: What is true regarding the cotter pin installation?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: If you cannot align the nut(s) slots with the hole for the pin(s), replace the nut(s).
Continue to tighten the nut(s) to align the nut(s) slots with the hole for the pin(s) if max torque is not reached.
Release the nut(s) to align the nut(s) slots with the hole for the pin(s) .

Questions.QuestionString: If the lock-wire and the safety cable are specified in the related locking procedure:(A, B1, B2)
Answers: The use of lock wire is preferable
The use of safety cable is preferable

Questions.QuestionString: For  0.8 mm locking  wire, the correct number twists per 1 inch length is:(A, B1, B2)
Regarding the torque load application , what is true?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: The torque load does not change when using an extension spanner at 90 degrees to the torque wrench.
The torque load does not change when the extension spanner align with the torque wrench.
The torque load does not change when using the extension spanner.

Questions.QuestionString: In general the correct sequence to torque tighten bolts that are near to each other is:(A, B1, B2)
What are the major powerplant assemblies?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Nose cowl, Fan Cowl, Thrust Reverser, Exhaust Nozzle.
Nose cowl, Thrust Reverser, Exhaust Nozzle.

Questions.QuestionString: What PDOS components does the nose cowl house?(B1)
Is the T20 probe heated?(B1)
For easier transportation , the Trent XWB engine’s splitting concept means:(B1)
Answers: The engine core, the fan case (with the external gearbox), the fan blades and the spinner can be separated.
The fan blades and the spinner, the core module, the exhaust module can be separated.
The compressor module, the core module, the exhaust module can be separated.

Questions.QuestionString: What ensure the correct alignment of the inlet cowl to the engine fan case?(B1)
What pressure does the PDOS operate at?(B1)
What power drives the PDOS system?(B1)
What medium is used by PDOS as the hydraulic fluid?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: The engine oil stored in its own dedicated reservoir.
The hydraulic stored in its own dedicated reservoir.
The fuel stored in its own dedicated reservoir.

Questions.QuestionString: If the wing Drop Nozzle Device(DND) is extended can you open the fan cowl?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Yes, in intermediate or in fully open position.
Yes, but only in intermediate position.

Questions.QuestionString: Which side of Fan Cowl is the oil access panel on?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Left Hand Side of TH/R Cowl

Questions.QuestionString: If the Fan cowl latch hooks are incorrectly fitted, can you close the latch access panel?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: It depends on the latch type.

Questions.QuestionString: Can you open/close the thrust reverser when PDOS is inoperative?(B1)
Answers: Yes, you can do it manually.

Questions.QuestionString: Is there anexhaust mixer unit fitted to the Trent XWB engine?
Answers: It depends on the thrust rating.

Questions.QuestionString: What load do the Trent XWBengine’s  mounts take?(B1)
Answers: FWD Mount: Vertical and Side, Rear Mount: Vertical, Side, Torsional, Thrust
FWD Mount: Vertical, Thrust and Side, Rear Mount: Vertical, Side, Torsional
FWD Mount: Vertical, Torsional,  and Side, Rear Mount: Vertical, Side, Thrust

Questions.QuestionString: The TH/R de-activation procedure for dispatch includes:(B1)
To stow/deploy the TH/Rev translating sleeves manually :(B1)
Answers: use a square drive tool on the upper actuator
use a square drive tool on the center actuator
use a square drive tool on the lower actuator

Questions.QuestionString: What is the reason there is a check valve on the IP bleed system?(B1)
Answers: Prevents the revers flow from the pneumatic system
Prevents the flow from the starting system

Questions.QuestionString: Name of the components that are on the engine wet drain system?(B1)
Answers: Pylon, fuel drain tank, oil scupper, PDOS
Starter, VFGs, Fuel pump,  Hydraulic pump

Questions.QuestionString: What other provision is on the drain mast?(A, B1, B2)
Are there any limits for dry drain leak rates?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Yes, but not from all components connected to the dry drain system
Yes, the limitations are specified in AMP task

Questions.QuestionString: How does the breather remove the oil from the airflow?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Centrifugal force and a Retimet segment.
By spiral vanes and Retimet segment.
By separate duct and Retimet segment.

Questions.QuestionString: Where is the fuel drains tank located?(B1)
Answers: R/H side of the Fan Case about the 4:30 Aft Looking Forward.
L/H side of the Fan Case about the 4:30 Aft Looking Forward.

Questions.QuestionString: What prevents air into the fuel system from the fuel drain tank?(B1)
Answers: The Float valve and Non-Return Valve.

Questions.QuestionString: How many hydraulic pumps are there on each engine?(A,B1,B2)
At what pressure do EDP operate at?(B1)
If EDP disconnected due to a fault can they be reset?(B1)
Is the VFG oil system taken from the engine oil system?(B1)
Answers: Yes, it shares the engine oil.
No, it shares the PDOS oil.

Questions.QuestionString: What items are used to control the temperature of the VFG oil?(B1)
Answers: SACOC & de-congealing valve, controlled by EEC.

Questions.QuestionString: Can the VFG be reset an unlimited amount of times? (B1)
If disconnected above idle, what actions must be carried out regarding VFG?(B1)
Answers: Change oil, reconnect and check operation.

Questions.QuestionString: Describe the features of the Trent XWB Engine?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: A two concentric shaft configuration with a very high by pass ratio with one piece disc and blade combination (Blisk) compressor design.
A three concentric shaft configuration with a very high by pass ratio with one piece disc and blade combination (Blisk) compressor design.
A three concentric shaft configuration with a very high by pass ratio with one piece disc and blade combination (Blisk) turbine design.

Questions.QuestionString: How many shafts does the Trent XWB-84  have?(A, B1, B2)
Most thrust is provided by?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: A gas flow that drives the turbines.

Questions.QuestionString: Where is the external gearbox located?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: At the bottom of the Fan Case
At the bottom of the Intermediate case.
At the bottom of the HPC rear case.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the direction of rotations for the engine’s shafts when seen from the front?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: LP&IP rotor turn CW (Clock-Wise), HP rotor turns CCW (Counter  Clock-Wise).
LP&IP rotor turn CCW, HP rotor turns CW.
LP rotor turns CCW (Counter Clock-Wise), IP&HP rotor turn CW (Clock-Wise).

Questions.QuestionString: What should be considered when ground running an engine?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Weather conditions, wind directions, gusting, operational limits.
MP task of the engine operational limits.
MP task of the engine safety precautions.

Questions.QuestionString: What does the LP system consists of ?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: A single stage compressor (Fan) assembly driven by a four-stage turbine.
A single stage compressor (Fan) assembly driven by a five-stage turbine.
A single stage compressor (Fan) assembly driven by a six-stage turbine.

Questions.QuestionString: What does the IP system consists of ?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: An eight-stage axial flow compressor driven by a two-stage turbine.
An nine-stage axial flow compressor driven by a two-stage turbine.
An ten-stage axial flow compressor driven by a two-stage turbine.

Questions.QuestionString: What does the HP system consists of ?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: An six-stage axial flow compressor driven by a single-stage turbine.
An five-stage axial flow compressor driven by a single-stage turbine.
An four-stage axial flow compressor driven by a single-stage turbine.

Questions.QuestionString: How many sealed compartment( Fire Zone) does the Trent WXB-84 engine have?(A, B1, B2)
The External Gearbox (EGB) is driven by:(A, B1, B2)
The thrust of the engine Trent WXB-84 is flat rated up to:(A, B1, B2)
The description of the combustion system on engine Trent WXB-84 is as follow:(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Annular construction incorporating 20 fuel spray nozzles and 2 igniter plugs.
Annular construction incorporating 24 fuel spray nozzles and 2 igniter plugs.
Annular construction incorporating 30 fuel spray nozzles and 2 igniter plugs.

Questions.QuestionString: Name the blade and turbine quantity’s(B1)
How many bearing chambers are the 8 ball and roller bearings installed in?(B1)
How many Fan Blades are fitted on Trent XWB engine?(A,B1,B2)
How are the Fan Blades retained in the hub?(B1)
How is the shear key secured in position into the disc slot?(B1)
Answers: By a recess located in the fan disc slot

Questions.QuestionString: How is the spinner attached to the engine?(B1)
Answers: By bolting to the spinner support ring that provides the compensation weights location.
By bolting into the LP compressor disc
By attaching to the annulus fillers.

Questions.QuestionString: In what module is the front bearing housing?(B1)
In which module is the internal gearbox fitted?(B1)
How many stages of BLISKS are there?(B1)
Answers: 3 on the first stages of the IPC
3 on the rear stages of the HPC
3 on the first stages of the HPC

Questions.QuestionString: How are the HPT blades installed on the turbine disc?(B1)
Where is the external gearbox driven from?(A,B1,B2)
Can we change the Fan Outlet Guide Vanes in service ?(B1)
Answers: Yes, each OGV segment can be replaced.

Questions.QuestionString: How can you turn the LP, IP, HP system?(B1)
Answers: LP carefully by hand, IP through cranking pad , HP drive via the oil breather
LP carefully by hand, IP with special tooling, HP drive via the oil breather
LP carefully by hand, IP with special tooling, HP drive via the oil breather

Questions.QuestionString: How many fan blades are allowed to be acceptably damaged in a fan set( regarding blade bands)?(B1)
Where are the fan balance weights installed?(B1)
Up to how many balance weights are available?(B1)
Where is the location of the Main Engine Fuel Pump Assembly(MEFP)?(B1)
Answers: On the R/H side of the rear face on the external gearbox
On the front face of the external gearbox
On the L/H side of the external gearbox.

Questions.QuestionString: What does the  fuel LP centrifugal pump provide to the fuel HP gear pumps?(B1)
Answers: Back up pressure for HP fuel pump.
Sufficient fuel for HP fuel pump.
Relief the load of fuel pump.

Questions.QuestionString: Why do we have a two stage HP pumps?(B1)
Answers: One for low RPM demands and one for high demands.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the large stage of the HP flow controlled by?(B1)
Answers: a combining spill valve in the HMU
It is controlled by the position of the combined Non Return Valve and the Pressure Relief Valve. Both in the MEFP
a bypass valve in the HMU

Questions.QuestionString: What is the location of the Fuel Oil Heat Exchanger(FOHE) and fuel filter assembly?(B1)
Answers: On the L/H side LP Fan Case
It is fitted to the internal face of the engine fan case
On the R/H side LP Fan Case

Questions.QuestionString: What is the purpose of the Fuel Oil Heat Exchanger(FOHE)?(B1)
Answers: To transfer the heat of the oil to the fuel system to prevent ice formation.
To transfer the heat of the fuel to the oil system to prevent the fuel overheat situation.
To transfer the heat of the oil to the fuel system or vice versa.

Questions.QuestionString: If the LP fuel filter becomes blocked how the fuel is delivered to the HP pump?(B1)
Answers: In this case the fuel is not delivered to HP pump stage anyway.
In this case the fuel is directly supplied to HMU

Questions.QuestionString: What is the location of the HMU?(B1)
Answers: On an adaptor block on the R/H side of the external gearbox.
On the R/H side fan case.
On the L/H side fan case.

Questions.QuestionString: How does the EEC get feedback from the metering servo valves?(B1)
What is the location of the Fuel Drain Tanks?(B1)
Answers: L/H side Fan Case about the 4:30 position aft looking forward
R/H side Fan Case about the 4:30 position aft looking forward

Questions.QuestionString: How is air prevented from entering the fuel system from the drain tanks?(B1)
Answers: The Non Return Valve( NRV) and the internal float valve
The drain valve and the internal float valve

Questions.QuestionString: What is the location of the fuel flow transmitter?
Answers: HP fuel tube between the HMU and the Fuel strainer.
Fuel tube between the fuel pump and HMU.
On FOHE between two stages of fuel pumps.

Questions.QuestionString: How do you ensure the correct fitment of the fuel spray nozzles(FSN)?(B1)
Answers: By use of the correct tooling.

Questions.QuestionString: How many fuel spray nozzles(FSN) are there?(A,B1,B2)
Why are there distributor weights in the fuel spray nozzles(FSN)?(B1)
Answers: For even fuel distribution between FSNs
For better fuel vaporization at FSN heads
To assure the FSNs correct installation

Questions.QuestionString: What different types of air supply can we use for the engine start?(A,B1,B2)
Where are the engine starting controls located?(B1)
Answers: On the center pedestal and overhead panel.

Questions.QuestionString: Where is the manual start switch located?(B1)
Answers: On the center pedestal and overhead panel.

Questions.QuestionString: How many position do the engine master levers have and what are they?(A,B1,B2)
Is the engine master switch “ hard wired” to the HMU?(B1)
Answers: Yes, for Fuel Metering Valve controlling

Questions.QuestionString: .  Is the starting page displayed on the primary or secondary ECAM?(A,B1,B2)
.  During start how do you know which ignition system is operating?(A,B1,B2)
Answers: Indicates A, B or both on starting page

Questions.QuestionString: .  Where is the starter control valve ( SCV) located?(A,B1,B2)
Answers: On the lower L/H side fan cowl about 8 o’clock
On the lower R/H side fan cowl about 4 o’clock
On the bottom of R/H fan cowl.

Questions.QuestionString: .  How is the starter control valve(SCV) commanded to operate?(A,B1,B2)
.  Does the EEC command the starter control valve (SCV) on manual start?(B1)
Answers: No, the manual start pushbutton is ‘hard wired’ to SCV

Questions.QuestionString: .  What does the Air Turbine Starter( ATS) rotate to drive the HPC?(B1)
Answers: External gearbox, angle drive, internal gearbox

Questions.QuestionString: .  Can the starter control valve (SCV) operate if it has electrical failed?(A,B1,B2)
Answers: It has a manual opening lever
It has a manual opening ½ inch square drive

Questions.QuestionString: .  How do you service the Air Turbine Starter( ATS) oil?(A,B1,B2)
Answers: This has independent system with the pressure and overfill ports.

Questions.QuestionString: .  What air cools the ignition leads?(B1)
Answers: Fan by-pass air from the ITCC manifold

Questions.QuestionString: .  What is the location of the two ignition exciter units?(A,B1,B2)
Answers: In zone 2 under Gas Generator Fairing

Questions.QuestionString: .  Where is the location of the igniter plugs?(A,B1,B2)
Answers: 4 o’clock and 5 o’clock on R/H side
7 o’clock and 8 o’clock on L/H side

Questions.QuestionString: .  How many start modes are there and what are they?(B1)
Answers: 4 modes: Auto, Manual, Dry Crank, Wet Crank.
5 modes: Auto, Manual, Automatic in flight, Quick Relight, Auto Relight.
7 modes: Auto, Manual, Automatic in flight, Quick Relight, Auto Relight, Dry Crank, Wet Crank

Questions.QuestionString: .  What is the duty cycle for an extended Air Turbine Starter (ATS) operation?(B1)
.  What is the duty cycle for a normal operation?(B1)
Answers: x3, 3minutes operation with 30 seconds cooling then 30 minutes cooling.
x2, 3minutes operation with 30 seconds cooling between then x1 further 1 minute operation then 30 minutes cooling.
x3, 3minutes operation with 30 seconds cooling between then x1 further 1 minute operation then 30 minutes cooling

Questions.QuestionString: .  What is the hydraulic medium used on the VSV/VIGV system?(B1)
.  How is the position of the VSV/VIGV feed back to the EEC?(B1)
Answers: LVDT, one installed on the master actuator.
LVDT, one per actuator feeding back to one channel.
RVDT, one installed on the master actuator.

Questions.QuestionString: .  What position do the VSV/VIGV fail to?(B1)
.  What are the locations of the VSV/VIGV actuators?(B1)
Answers: 5 o’clock and 10 o’clock position on each side of HPC.
5 o’clock and 10 o’clock position on each side of IPC.
5 o’clock and 10 o’clock position on each side of fan case.

Questions.QuestionString: .  What air supply is used for muscle power on the compressor bleed valves?(B1)
.  Which solenoid block provides the air supply to control the compressor handling bleed valves?(B1)
Answers: L/H block located behind the gas generator fairing.
Center block located behind the gas generator fairing.
L/H block located behind the gas generator fairing.

Questions.QuestionString: .  Does the compressor bleed valves feedback the position?(B1)
Answers: Some of them provide position feedback.

Questions.QuestionString: .  What would you expect to see if the bleed valves are stuck open/ closed?(B1)
Answers: Open hot hung starts, Closed High EGT.
Open High EGT, Closed hot hung starts.

Questions.QuestionString: .  How many IP8 handling bleed valves are there?(A,B1,B2)
.  How many HP3 handling bleed valves are there?(A,B1,B2)
.  What item does the R/H solenoid block control?(B1)
.  How many solenoids are on the L/H controller block? (B1)
.  How many solenoids are on the R/H controller block?(B1)
.  Why do we ventilate the engine zones?(A,B1,B2)
Answers: To cool down the components installed in zones.

Questions.QuestionString: .  In zone 2 describe the ventilation air flow through the zone?
Answers: RAM air enters in intake holes in forward location and exits via grids
Fan air enters in intake holes in forward location and exits via grids.
RAM air enters in dedicated holes and discharged overboard .

Questions.QuestionString: .  What type of temperature sensors are in zone 1&2?(B1)
.  What burst ducts is the zone 1 temperature sensor likely to detect?(A,B1,B2)
.  What burst ducts is the zone 2 temperature sensor likely to detect?(B1)
.  What type of temperature sensor is in zone 3?(A,B1,B2)
.  Which sensor is used for NAC indications? (A,B1,B2)
.  HP3 cooling air is used to cool what three main areas?(A,B1,B2)
Answers: IPT cooling, IPTNGV stage 1 cooling, sealing of the HPT rear face, IP 1 & 2 front rims, IPT rear face.
HPT cooling, IPTNGV stage 1 cooling, IP 1 & 2 front rims, IPT rear face.
HPT cooling, IPTNGV stage 1 cooling, IPT rear face.

Questions.QuestionString: .  HP6 cooling air is used to cool what three main areas?(B1)
Answers: HPT cooling, ventilate the combustor, HPT seal segments
IPT cooling, ventilate the combustor, HPT seal segments
IPT cooling, ventilate the combustor, LPT seal segments

Questions.QuestionString: .  What is the purpose of the TCC system?(A,B1,B2)
Answers: To cool the LP, IP turbine case
To cool the HP, IP turbine case
To cool the LP, IP &HP turbine case

Questions.QuestionString: .  What is the medium used for the TCC system?(B1)
.  IP/HP TCC valves. Can they be locked?(A,B1,B2)
.  Where is the locking bolt of IP/HP TCC valves located?(A,B1,B2)
.  What position does the IP/HP TCC fail safe to?(B1)
.  How does the TCC valve feedback its position to the EEC?(B1)
Answers: With the LVDT in the valve actuator.
With the reed switch in the body of the valve actuator.
With the RVDT in the valve actuator.

Questions.QuestionString: .  What medium is used to actuate the LPTCC valve?(B1)
.  In what position is the LPTCC valve in cruise?(B1)
.  In what position is the LPTCC valve in all other case except cruise?(B1)
.  What electrical supplies are provided to the EEC?(A,B1,B2)
Answers: A/C 230VAC Emergency, A/C 230VAC Normal, PMA above 6.46% N3
A/C 115VAC Emergency, A/C 230VAC Normal, PMA above 6.46% N3
A/C 115VAC Emergency, A/C 115VAC Normal, PMA above 6.46% N3

Questions.QuestionString: .  What is the location of the PMA?(A,B1,B2)
.  What provides the primary N3 signal from the PMA?
Answers: A single phase winding within the PMA, signals to both channel A and B
A dual phase windings within the PMA, one for a  channel
A dual phase windings within the PMA, signals to both channel A and B

Questions.QuestionString: .  What colours are indicated with EEC channel and what are they?(A,B1,B2)
Answers: Green channel A, Yellow Channel B
Yellow channel A, Blue Channel B
Yellow channel A, Green Channel B

Questions.QuestionString: .  On an electrical harness loom on engine, if it had FC in the identification what does that indicate?(A,B1,B2)
.  On a LPT over speed what happens automatically?(B1)
Answers: Fuel flow decreases, bleed valves open, VSVs move to close low speed condition
Fuel flow stops, bleed valves open, VSVs move to close low speed condition
Fuel flow decreases, bleed valves open, VSVs move to open high speed condition

Questions.QuestionString: .  How is a LP shaft breakage detected?(B1)
Answers: The EEC compares the LPC and LPT speeds, looking for differences between them
The EEC detects a rapid acceleration of N1.
The EEC detects a rapid acceleration of LPT speeds.

Questions.QuestionString: .  IPTOS what is the system comparing?(B1)
Answers: The N2C speed with TCAF ( Turbine Cooling Air Front) and TCAR( Turbine Cooling Air Rear)in case of High EGT shaft break.
The EEC detects a rapid acceleration of N2.
The N2 Compressor speed with N2 Turbine speed.

Questions.QuestionString: .  N1 shaft over speed what is the system looking at?(B1)
Answers: Looking for NLC and NLT over speeding at the same rate

Questions.QuestionString: .  N2 shaft over speed what is the system looking at?(B1)
Answers: The N2Compressor speed with N2 Turbine speed ( EGT within certain predetermined parameter)
The N2 Turbine speed with TCAF and TCAR ( EGT within certain predetermined parameter)
The N2Compressor speed with TCAF and TCAR ( EGT within certain predetermined parameter)

Questions.QuestionString: .  How does the system know if there has been an IPT over speed?(B1)
Answers: The TCAF and TCAR arm the system once within certain predetermined parameters then shuts engine down if N2Trise up
The TCAF and TCAR arm the system once within certain predetermined parameters then shuts engine down if N2C slow down
The TCAF and TCAR exceed certain predetermined limit

Questions.QuestionString: .  What is the EMU used for?(A,B1,B2)
.  How can new software be loaded on EMU?(B1,B2)
.  What data does the DEP (Data Entry Plug) contain?(B1,B2)
Answers: ESN, Rating, TGT trim, Standard, Intermix provision
Engine P/N, ESN, thrust rating, hours and cycles.

Questions.QuestionString: .  At Engine power up what does the EEC read to get relevant Engine information?
.  When should the DEP be reprogrammed?(A,B1,B2)
Answers: The DEP is new to the engine, rating change, trim valve change after overhaul
The DEP is new to the engine or replacement of EEC.
The DEP is new to the engine or replacement of EMU.

Questions.QuestionString: .  From which zone is the nacelle temperature indication obtained?(A,B1,B2)
.  Which temperature is synthesized by the EEC?(B1,B2)
.  How many LP speed sensors are located in the Front Bearing Housing(FBH)?(B1,B2)
.  How many IP speed sonsors are located in the Front Bearing Housing( FBH)?(B1)
Answers: 4, 2 for EEC channel A, 2 for EEC channel B.
2, 1for EEC channel A, 1for EEC channel B.

Questions.QuestionString: .  Which speed is the controlling speed for the XWB thrust?(A,B1,B2)
.  When in normal operation the EEC uses aircraft air data, when this is unavailable where is P0 signal obtained?(B1)
Answers: Transducer installed in the inlet cowl.

Questions.QuestionString: .  State the location of the T20 probe?(A,B1,B2)
.  When in normal operation the EEC uses aircraft air data, when this is unavailable where is T20 signal obtained?(B1)
Answers: T0 sensor within the NLG bay

Questions.QuestionString: .  Which channel of the EEC senses T25 for Engine Health Monitoring(EHM)?(B1)
.  Where is the location of the T25 sensor?(B1)
.  State the location of the T30 sensor?(B1)
.  Which sensor is used in the detection of inclement weather?(B1)
.  T30 sensors: do they both signal to both channels or individually?(B1)
Answers: Each channel of the EEC receives one T30 thermocouple signal.
Both channel of the EEC are fed by 2 T30 thermocouple for redundancy.
Both channel of the EEC are fed by one T30 thermocouple.

Questions.QuestionString: .  What is the purpose of the T50 Thermocouple?(B1,B2)
Answers: To provide the EEC with a sense of LPT exit temperature EHM only.
EEC uses it for warning purpose.

Questions.QuestionString: .  Where is the Ps42 sensor located?(B1)
.  What is the location of the TGT thermocouples?(B1,B2)
.  From what is the EGT derived for the cockpit display?(B1,B2)
Answers: It is derived from TGT from calculations of TET.

Questions.QuestionString: .  Engine vibration: where is the transducer located?(B1)
.  How are the weights identified for trim balancing?(B1)
Answers: No bolts, small, medium and large bolts.

Questions.QuestionString: .  What keep the translating cowls of the thrust reverser in stowed position?( B1)
Answers: primary locks installed on each  screw-jack actuator
primary locks installed on 2 locking  screw-jack actuators
primary locks installed on 2 locking screw-jack actuators and the tertiary locks

Questions.QuestionString: .  Inside the outer wall of each T/R cowl, there are:(A, B1, B2)
Answers: The five T/R blocker door assembly
The six T/R blocker door assembly
The seven T/R blocker door assembly

Questions.QuestionString: .  The tertiary lock is controlled by:( B1)
.  The functions of the ETRAC:( B1)
Answers: Control an actuator-located primary lock devices and  the tertiary locks
Control the tertiary locks and Drive the two T/R motors(one on the left cowl and one on the right cowl)
Drive the two T/R motors and Control an actuator-located primary lock devices.

Questions.QuestionString: .  The ETRAC is located in : (A, B1, B2)
.  Which T/R actuator has manual drive device?( B1)
.  The T/R actuators are driven by: (A, B1, B2)
.  To perform Thrust Reverser (T/R) cycling test:( B1)
Answers: Just carry out cockpit actions instructed on maintenance terminal.
You can do it on OMT only
You have to do cockpit actions and action on IRP as instructed on maintenance terminal

Questions.QuestionString: .  What is the location of the oil tank?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Fan case R/H side 3 o’clock position
Fan case L/H side 3 o’clock position

Questions.QuestionString: .  Where is the oil scavenge filter located?(A, B1)
Answers: Mounted on the scavenge oil pump assembly.

Questions.QuestionString: .  How is the oil flow in the scavenge line maintained if the oil scavenge filter becomes blocked?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: By the use of a by-pass valve
By the use of a standby pump
By the use of a back-up pump

Questions.QuestionString: .  How many Magnetic Chip Detectors(MCD)may be there?(A, B1, B2)
.  Where is the oil pressure filter located and how is it identified?(A, B1)
Answers: On the oil pressure pump, painted yellow.
On the oil scavenge pump, pained yellow.
On the oil tank, pained yellow.

Questions.QuestionString: .  When a scavenge filter becomes blocked is the clogged indication immediately displayed in cockpit?(B1)
.  What type of oil temperature sensors are they?(B1)
.  Where is the oil scavenging differential pressure transducer located?(B1)
.  What is the location of the oil pressure differential pressure transducer?(B1)
.  Where are the oil differential pressure transducer points taken from?(B1)
Answers: The outlet of the FOHE and the internal gearbox.
The outlet of the oil pressure pump and the internal gearbox.
The outlet of the oil pressure pump and the external gearbox.

Questions.QuestionString: .  What is the pressure range of the oil pressure differential transducer?(B1)
.  What is the location of the low oil pressure switch?(B1)
Answers: the upper face of the oil pump.
the upper face of the FOHE.

Questions.QuestionString: .  The FBH vent valve: how many positions does it have?(B1)
.  What controls the FBH valve?(A, B1, B2)
.  When would the FBH vent valve  be closed?(A, B1, B2)
.  In what conditions would the FBH vent valve be open?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: At high power settings and at flight idle at altitude
At low power settings and at idle

Questions.QuestionString: .  The engine oil vent system consists of?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: FBH vent valve and centrifugal breather
A de-aerator side the oil tank and a centrifugal breather
FBH vent valve and vent pump

Questions.QuestionString: .  What does the vent air flow through to extract the oil?(B1)
Answers: A centrifugal breather with a Retimet segments
A de-aerator side the oil tank
An air/oil separator installed on lubrication unit

Questions.QuestionString: .  On scavenge oil filter removal what basic provisions should be made?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: A clean container to collect the oil and filter

Questions.QuestionString: .  On oil pressure filter replacement how tight should the filter bowl be tightened?(A, B1, B2)
.  How is the engine oil level checked after 6 hours after engine shutdown?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Perform the engine running 5 minutes then check/fill the engine with oil as necessary.
If oil level is visible in the sight glass, it means acceptable.
If oil level is below the ‘FULL’ mark, it means acceptable.

Questions.QuestionString: What are the major powerplant assemblies?(A, B1, B2)
Answers: Nose cowl, Fan Cowl, Thrust Reverser, Exhaust Nozzle.
Nose cowl, Thrust Reverser, Exhaust Nozzle.

Questions.QuestionString: For easier transportation , the Trent XWB engine’s splitting concept means:
Answers: The engine core, the fan case (with the external gearbox), the fan blades and the spinner can be separated.
The fan blades and the spinner, the core module, the exhaust module  can be separated.
The compressor module, the core module, the exhaust module  can be separated.

Questions.QuestionString: What power drives the PDOS system?
Which side of Fan Cowl is the oil access panel on?
Answers: Left Hand Side of TH/R Cowl

Questions.QuestionString: What is the direction of rotations for the engine’s shafts when seen from the front?
Answers: LP&IP rotor turn CW(ClockWise), HP rotor turns CCW(Counter ClockWise).
LP&IP rotor turn CCW, HP rotor turns CW.
LP rotor turns CCW( Counter ClockWise), IP&HP rotor turn CW(ClockWise).

Questions.QuestionString: Name the blade and turbine quantity’s
Where is the external gearbox driven from?
How can you turn the LP, IP, HP system?
Answers: LP carefully by hand, IP through cranking pad , HP drive via the oil breather
LP carefully by hand, IP with special tooling, HP drive via the oil breather
LP carefully by hand, IP through cranking pad, HP drive via the PMA.

Questions.QuestionString: Why do we have a two stage HP pumps?
Answers: One for low RPM demands and one for high demands.

Questions.QuestionString: Why are there distributor weights in the fuel spray nozzles( FSN)?
Answers: For even fuel distribution between FSNs
For better fuel vaporization at FSN heads
To assure the FSNs correct installation

Questions.QuestionString: How is the starter control valve( SCV) commanded to operate?
What air cools the ignition leads?
Answers: Fan by-pass air from the ITCC manifold

Questions.QuestionString: What is the hydraulic medium used on the VSV/VIGV system?
What air supply is used for muscle power on the compressor bleed valves?
What type of temperature sensor is in zone 3?
In what position is the LPTCC valve in cruise?
What electrical supplies are provided to the EEC?
Answers: A/C 230VAC Emergency, A/C 230VAC Normal, PMA above 6.46% N3
A/C 115VAC Emergency, A/C 230VAC Normal, PMA above 6.46% N3
A/C 115VAC Emergency, A/C 115VAC Normal, PMA above 6.46% N3

Questions.QuestionString: From which zone is the nacelle temperature indication obtained?
From what is the EGT derived for the cockpit display?
Answers: It is derived from TGT from calculations  of  TET.

Questions.QuestionString: The T/R actuators are driven by:
Propulsion Control System (PCS) consists of:
Answers: Engine Interface Function (EIF) applications, Engine Electronic Controller (EEC), Engine Monitoring Unit (EMU), and Engine Thrust Reverser Actuation Controller (ETRAC).
EIF applications and the Full Authority Digital Engine Control (FADEC).
EIF applications, EEC and Hydro Mechanical Unit( HMU).

Questions.QuestionString: How many Fan blades are fitted on Trent XWB-84 engine?
What load do the engine’s  mounts take?
Answers: FWD Mount: Vertical and Side, Rear Mount: Vertical, Side, Torsional, Thrust
FWD Mount: Vertical, Thrust and Side, Rear Mount: Vertical, Side, Torsional
FWD Mount: Vertical, Torsional,  and Side, Rear Mount: Vertical, Side, Thrust

Questions.QuestionString: How many bearing chambers are the 8 ball and roller bearings installed in?
What medium is used by PDOS as the hydraulic fluid?
Answers: The engine oil stored in its own dedicated reservoir.
The hydraulic stored in its own dedicated reservoir.
The fuel stored in its own dedicated reservoir.

Questions.QuestionString: Which speed is the controlling speed for the Trent XWB thrust?
What prevents air ingestion into the fuel system from the fuel drain tank?
Answers: The Float valve and Non-Return Valve.

Questions.QuestionString: Is the engine master lever “ hard wired” to the HMU?
Answers: Yes, for fuel HP SOV controlling.
Yes, for Fuel Metering Valve controlling

Questions.QuestionString: What is the Engine Monitoring Unit (EMU) used for?
Answers: Engine Health Monitoring and vibration calculation.

Questions.QuestionString: What data does the DEP (Data Entry Plug) contain?
Answers: ESN, Rating, N1 trim,TGT trim, Standard, Intermix provision
Engine P/N, ESN, thrust rating, hours and cycles.

Questions.QuestionString: During start how do you know which ignition system is operating?
Answers: Indicates A, B or both on starting page

Questions.QuestionString: What air cools the ignition leads?
Answers: Fan by-pass air from the ITCC manifold

Questions.QuestionString: What is the hydraulic medium used on the VSV/VIGV system?
What is the fail-safe position of the VSV/VIGV system?
How many handling bleed valves are installed on IP and HP compressors?
Answers: 6: 3 on IP compressor, 3 on HP compressor.

Questions.QuestionString: How are the handling bleed valves controlled?
Answers: By the solenoids that provide the control air supply.
By the EHSVs that provide the servo fuel supply.
By the SSPCs that provide the control electricity.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the purpose of the Turbine Clearance Control( TCC) system?
Answers: To cool the LP, IP turbine case
To cool the IP, HP turbine case
To cool the LP, IP &HP turbine case

Questions.QuestionString: What is the medium used for the Turbine Clearance Control (TCC) system for cooling?
What electrical supplies are provided to the EEC?
Answers: A/C 230VAC Emergency, A/C 230VAC Normal, PMA above 6% N3
A/C 115VAC Emergency, A/C 230VAC Normal, PMA above 6% N3
A/C 115VAC Emergency, A/C 115VAC Normal, PMA above 6% N3

Questions.QuestionString: What provides the primary N3 signal to the EEC?
Answers: A single phase winding within the PMA.
4 speed sensors at the front of HP rotor.
4 speed sensors at the rear of HP rotor.

Questions.QuestionString: How is a LP shaft breakage detected?
Answers: The EEC compares the LPC and LPT speeds, looking for differences between them
The EEC detects a rapid deceleration of N1.
The EEC detects a rapid acceleration of  LPT speeds.

Questions.QuestionString: How many speed sensors are located in the Front Bearing Housing( FBH)?
Answers: 8: 4 for LP speed, 4 for IP speed.

Questions.QuestionString: From what is the EGT derived for the cockpit display?
To stow/deploy the TH/Rev translating sleeves manually :
Answers: use a square drive tool on the upper actuator
use a square drive tool on the center actuator
use a square drive tool on the lower actuator

Questions.QuestionString: How does the engine oil pressure indicated?
Answers: By delta pressure of the supply line and the scavenge line.
By the absolute pressure of the supply.
By the absolute pressure of the scavenge line.

Questions.QuestionString: What is true regarding the Front Bearing Housing(FBH) vent valve operation?
Answers: Open at high power settings and closed at low power setting.
Close at high power settings and open at low power setting.
Modulating  as the engine power change.

Questions.QuestionString: How is the starter control valve( SCV) commanded to operate?
What is the starter duty cycle for a normal operation?
Answers: x3, 3minutes operation with 30 seconds cooling then 30 minutes cooling.
x2, 3minutes operation with 30 seconds cooling between then x1 further 1 minute operation then 30 minutes cooling.
x3, 3minutes operation with 30 seconds cooling between then x1 further 1 minute operation then 30 minutes cooling
